state.description: This is where you might entertain friends...if you had any. The room is dimly lit by a lamp and the weak, jittering light of the fireplace. You see a comfy, albeit slightly moldy, arm chair facing the fireplace; your phone atop a spindly table; and a bookcase full of books you've skimmed. There is the front door, a window, the door to the kitchen, and a staircase leading to the second floor.

Your beige connection to civilization is looking awfully inadequate right now. You know there is a mostly empty address book in a drawer in the table the phone sits upon.
state.get: Unplugging it from the wall might sort of defeat the purpose. Might be best to leave it here.

state.description: Your beige connection to civilization is looking awfully inadequate right now. You can see your address book in the open drawer of the table that the phone sits on.
state.get: Unplugging it from the wall might sort of defeat the purpose. Might be best to leave it here.

state.description: A window that yawns a view to the dark front yard. You can just make out your mailbox under a flickering street lamp.
Almost bursting at the seams from years of your curvy physique pressing upon it.
state.get: Then you would be holding the chair instead of it you holding you! But, no.

state.description: Now it's in front of the door!
state.get: Then you would be holding the chair instead of it you holding you! But, no.

state.description: Looks dumb
state.get: It probably looks better up there.

state.description: Oh wow, looks like somebody's outside!
So that you can pretend you're smarter to yourself, even though you know you've read none of them. You see such titles as:
state.get: While each book is pretty light, the whole bookcase weighs quite a bit. Maybe stick to one book at a time, JFK.

state.description: A warm fire roars cozily in the old brick fireplace.
state.get: Are you looking for a one-way trip to the burn unit again?

state.description: Secret passage open.
state.get: Are you looking for a one-way trip to the burn unit again?

state.description: Its dark wood looms ominously. There is a peep hole that you never thought you'd need to use.
A plain white banister and stairs lead up to the second floor.
I don't see that.

The book contains these entries (All numbers are Speed-dial): Paulie's Pizza..................1
Ms. Jones from Next Door........2
Phillip Glean's Free Screams....3
911.............................4
For fires!
state.get: You swipe it like the fucking hamburgler.
I think you already got it PAL

state.description: The Drawer. It's closed.
The Drawer. It's open.
Looks like a book
WOW YOU OPENED THE PAPSSAGE WITH THIS OOOK.
state.get: You already pulled it and did the addams family thing ya big doof.

state.description: Looks like a book
Looks like a book
Looks like a book
Shines bright.
Door to the Kitchen

This is where you push food into your mouth, sometimes after cooking it. Stains and spills dot the floor, walls, and surfaces. In the center of the room is a counter where you usually prepare your food. On it rests a toaster, a blender, and a knife block. Standard kitchen appliances fill the room, like your refrigerator, sink, and a stovetop/oven. There is a door to the living room and a door leading to the back yard.
A knife block with 3 knives.
state.get: Can't get the whole block, dummy.

state.description: A knife block with 2 knives.
state.get: Can't get the whole block, dummy.

state.description: A knife.
I don't think it's in the room anymore
There are tiny slivers of grass illuminated by the light coming through the kitchen windows and doors. Beyond is impenetrable darkness.
A plain, white, food-cooling box. A smiley-face magnet pins an "A+" math test to the front.
state.get: Just because it's running, doesn't mean you have to go catch it. HA HA.

state.description: The fridge door is open.
state.get: Just because it's running, doesn't mean you have to go catch it. HA HA.

state.description: Ah, the slightly colder sibling of the fridge. But I bet you knew that already.
state.get: Just because it's running, doesn't mean you have to go catch it. HA HA.

state.description: The freezer door is open.
state.get: Just because it's running, doesn't mean you have to go catch it. HA HA.

state.description: I think you used these once to make your favorite mixed drink, water on the rocks.
10% more orange!
state.get: You grab the orange juice and shove it in your pocket. The cold metal cannister presses against your leg and for a moment, you feel alive.

state.description: Slightly grimy and mostly slimy. There's a cabinet under it.
It's the cabinet under the sink! And it's closed!
It's the cabinet under the sink! And it's open!
Bucket-y
Where some of your most impressive water boiling has taken place. Also some of your most impressive ignoring burns to look cool (it's not cool). There's a lighter sitting on the top.
Where some of your REALLY impressive water boiling has taken place.
state.get: In? Not a good idea my friend.

state.description: Bread goes in, toast comes out. You could call it magic, but you would be wrong. You're often wrong.
state.get: You bash the toaster against the counter, separating it into many pieces. None of them seem particularly useful except for the spring, which you pocket.

state.description: Rest in pieces.
state.get: I think you already grabbed the useful bits.

state.description: Most recently used for impromptu bartending. Residue of Mountain Dew and Malibu covers the inside.
You know it's not illegal to clean up every once in awhile, right? Anyway, it's a big linoleum countertop. On it is a toaster, a blender, and a knife block.
They lead to the basement.
For lighting stuff, ya know?
state.get: This might come in handy for lighting stuff.

state.description: To your left, the stairs to the first floor stretch down, ending in the door you'd like to get as far away from as possible. You see doors to the bathroom and bedroom. And a gas mask.
To your left, the stairs to the first floor stretch down, ending in the door you'd like to get as far away from as possible. You see doors to the bathroom and bedroom.
They lead downstairs.
The door to your bedroom.
The door to your bathroom.
It's a gas mask!

state.get: You already grabbed the gassy boy.

state.description: Where you do all your poops!
Where you do all your poops!
Where you do all your poops!
Where you do all your poops!
It's there so nobody can see you pooping.
Nice. This baby's vintage. Faux-chrome, porcelain, uh, rustic...exterior...got some pipes there...functions without issue, mostly...look it's a sink. It's a fucking sink.
Nice. This baby's vintage. Faux-chrome, porcelain, uh, rustic...exterior...got some pipes there...functions without issue, mostly...look it's a sink. It's a fucking sink.

This is where the magic happens.
state.get: You reach around in the water for a few seconds. Nothing of interest.

state.description: This is where the magic happens.
state.get: You reach around in the water for a few seconds. Nothing of interest.

state.description: It's a cabinet! The door is closed.
It's a cabinet! The door is open.
Don't drink it!
state.get: You grab the bottle of bleach.

state.description: This is where you would shower if you showered. You know, maybe you deserve this.
The curtain is open
The curtain is closed
Normally a safe place, that feeling's now perverted and you feel worse here than anywhere else. Might be the abominable decor, but who's to say?
You could hide under the covers and cower in fear...
Wow, what a big closet for so few things. Actually, there's just one. It's a flashlight.
Lights up
Leads to the hallway.
You stare blankly at the art, pretending to understand it.
Inside is a few important items including the pistol you bought. If only you could remember the damn combination.
All of your trophies from marksmanship competitions live here. Plenty of participation and honorable mentions.
state.get: There's too much glass in the way.

state.description: For recording things!
For shooting!

The low light of the basement reveals piled boxes, a tool bench, and the washer and dryer. For a moment you have an insane desire to grab your clothes out of the dryer and start acting as though nothing is wrong.
The staircase leading up from the basement
for washin
for dryin
for gasin'
It's ammonia, I don't fucking know, read a book asshole.
Works good.
This looks like some idiot.
state.get: Maybe this will be good for something besides diabetes.
Type I diabetes is plenty, let's not go for Type II.

state.description: Works good.
It's a secret.
Living Room door.
Outside door.
Beep Boop.
I guess even maniacs don't want to wear the same thing every day.
state.get: What you've got on is just...good enough.

state.description: A metal table covered in various surgical tools and items. Specifically, a scalpel, a pair of scissors, and a spoon.
state.get: What do you want to get?

state.description: Sharp.
Probably used for something distasteful. Or for cutting out paper hearts.
For cereals and soups.
It's your back yard! There's a shed and the back door to your house.
A big old shed.
There is a lock on the outside of the shack; you might be able to trap the intruder in there, if you could find a way to lure him in.
The door back to your house.
You'll have to be a bit more specific. There's the back door and the shed door.
THE SHED
biek.
state.get: This thing is much too beat up to try and use now. Besides, what would you do with it - pedal away from the killer?

state.description: Big and plastic
state.get: This thing crinkles and makes a ton of noise when you move it, so you decide you shouldn't carry it around through the house. You might find some use for it in here though.

state.description: A wet noodle
state.get: You open the valve but only a pathetic trickle of water dribbles from the end. Useless.

state.description: For leaves
state.get: It's too unwieldy to carry around with you, but maybe you can use it with something else in here.

specialresponse.response:
The book contains these entries (All numbers are Speed-dial): Paulie's Pizza..................1
Ms. Jones from Next Door........2
Phillip Glean's Free Screams....3
911.............................4

Well, okay. You spread ignition fluid over the logs, glancing back to the front door while your heart races. You duck your head and climb into the soot-covered hole, balancing yourself delicately on the logs. As you strike the match, you briefly see the blackened bricks around you before you drop the match to your feet. As you burn, you grimly think, "at least I died on my own terms."

The phone rings just once before a gruff, loud voice barks "Paulie's Pizza, whaddya want?" "Paulie, it's me, I need help!", you hurriedly exclaim. Paulie, recognizing your voice immediately, says, "Oh, it's you. Your usual will be there in 30 minutes," before hanging up. Great! Maybe now you can die with a full stomach at least.
When the line connects, all that can be heard is a single, unbroken, bloodcurdling scream. Man, you can always count on Phil.

The phone rings once or twice and a curt woman answers, "9-1-1, what's your emergency?" You quickly explain that a maniac is trying to break into your home and murder you. The operator is taken aback for a moment, but calmly tells you, "Remain in your home, officers will be there in 20 minutes."
As you tilt the book to grab it, THE PASSAGE OPENS WOO WOO WOO!
